name: Adam Levine
description:
'''Adam Noah Levine''' ({{IPAc-en|l|ə|ˈ|v|iː|n}} {{respell|lə|VEEN}}; born March 18, 1979) is an American musician who is the lead singer, rhythm guitarist and sole continuous member of the [[pop rock]] band [[Maroon 5]]. 

Levine began his musical career in 1994 with the band Kara's Flowers, for which he served as lead vocalist and lead guitarist. After the commercial failure of their only album, ''[[The Fourth World (album)|The Fourth World]]'', the group was reformed in 2001 as Maroon 5 – with [[James Valentine (musician)|James Valentine]] replacing him as lead guitarist. In 2002, they released their first album, ''[[Songs About Jane]]'', which went multi-platinum in the US; since then, they have released seven more albums: ''[[It Won't Be Soon Before Long]]'' (2007), ''[[Hands All Over (album)|Hands All Over]]'' (2010), ''[[Overexposed (album)|Overexposed]]'' (2012), ''[[V (Maroon 5 album)|V]]'' (pronounced: "five") (2014), ''[[Red Pill Blues]]'' (2017), ''[[Jordi (album)|Jordi]]'' (2021), and ''[[Love Is Like]]'' (2025). As part of Maroon 5, Levine has received [[List of awards and nominations received by Maroon 5|multiple accolades]], including three [[Grammy Awards]]. As a solo artist, he achieved concurrent commercial success with his guest appearance on [[Gym Class Heroes]]' 2011 single "[[Stereo Hearts]]", which peaked within the top five of the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].

From 2011 to 2019, and again in 2025, Levine has been featured as a coach on [[NBC]]'s reality talent show ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]''. The winners of multiple seasons ([[The Voice (American season 1)|1]], [[The Voice (American season 5)|5]], and [[The Voice (American season 9)|9]]) belonged to his team. In 2012, Levine made his acting debut as the recurring character Leo Morrison in the second season of the television series ''[[American Horror Story]]''. He also appeared in the films ''[[Begin Again (film)|Begin Again]]'' (2013), ''[[Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping]]'' (2016), ''[[Fun Mom Dinner]]'' and ''[[The Clapper (film)|The Clapper]]'' (both 2017). Levine launched his eponymous fragrance line in 2013. The same year, he collaborated with [[Kmart (United States)|Kmart]] and ShopYourWay.com to develop his menswear collection. He also owns a record label, [[222 Records]], and a production company, 222 Productions, which produced television shows ''[[Sugar (2018 TV series)|Sugar]]'' and ''[[Songland]]''. In 2013, ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' reported that "sources familiar with his many business dealings" estimated Levine would earn more than $35 million that year.
